Preprocess the raw data (spiking times of single neurons).

mtcdb.preprocess.firing_rates [module]

Convert raw spike times to firing rates.

spikes_to_rates(spk, tbin, tmax)[source]

Convert a spike train into a firing rate time course.

Parameters:

  • spk (ArrayLike) – Spiking times.

  • tbin (float) – Time bin (in seconds).

  • tmax (float) – Duration of the recording period (in seconds).

Returns:

frates – Firing rate time course (in spikes/s).

Return type:

NumpyArray

See also

numpy.histogram

Count the number of spikes in each bin. Parameter bin: Bin edges, including the rightmost edge. Two outputs: hist (number of spikes in each bin), edges.

Notes

Algorithm

  • Divide the recording period [0, tmax] into bins of size tbin.

  • Count the number of spikes in each bin.

  • Divide the number of spikes in each bin by the bin size tbin.

Bin edges are obtained with numpy.arange(), with the last bin edge at tmax + tbin for the last bin to be included.
